meanings.definition: To subject (wood, coal, etc.) to intense heat without melting in order to drive off volatile constituents.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith will torrify the wood to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The factory torrifies the coal to remove impurities.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally torrified the wooden spoon, turning it into a mini torch!
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays torrify the desert sand, making it scorching hot.
meanings.sent5: The intense flames torrify the metal, shaping it into a sturdy structure.

meanings.definition: To subject (a substance) to intense heat in a vacuum in order to produce a nonporous surface.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will torrify the glass to create a smooth finish.
meanings.sent2: The manufacturer torrifies the plastic to make it impermeable.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally torrified the clay, turning it into a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The heat torrifies the liquid, transforming it into a solid state.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat torrifies the metal, giving it a polished look.
